turns.content: nats.org

NATS stands for North America Telugu Society. NATS is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting and preserving the cultural heritage of Telugu-speaking people in North America. For more information about NATS and its events, please visit the official website at [www.nats.org](http://www.nats.org).

invitation for fund raiser

It sounds like you are looking for information on an invitation for a fund-raising event being held by the North America Telugu Society (NATS). I'm not sure what specific information you are looking for. Could you please provide more context or clarify your question?
want to send a invitation to fund raiser on feb 11th 2023

Here's a template for a simple invitation for a fund-raising event:

Subject: Invitation to NATS Fund-Raiser on February 11th, 2023

Dear [Name],

You are cordially invited to join us for a special event in support of the North America Telugu Society (NATS). Our fund-raiser will take place on Saturday, February 11th, 2023 from 5:30 PM at Moghul Ball Room (Mirage), 1655 Oak Tree Road, Edison, NJ 08820.

This is an excellent opportunity to support NATS and its mission to promote and preserve the cultural heritage of Telugu-speaking people in North America. Your attendance and support will be greatly appreciated.

Please RSVP by [Date] to confirm your attendance. We look forward to seeing you there!

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[NATS Fund-Raiser Organizer]

Note: You may need to customize the invitation to fit your specific event and audience.
suggest title for fundraiser

Here are five potential titles for a fund-raising event:

1. "Raising Our Voices for a Better Tomorrow"
2. "Empowering Our Community: A Fund-Raiser for NATS"
3. "Uniting for a Cause: A Night of Giving for NATS"
4. "Join Hands to Build a Stronger Future"
5. "Investing in Our Culture: A Fund-Raiser for NATS"

Note: The title should be chosen based on the specific goals and focus of the fund-raising event.

As discussed in last Sunday’s meeting, we must have all your support to help raise funds to have a successful conference and most importantly to reach our objective of giving back in the form of service. 
There are a few ways you all can help:
1. Please reach out to your friends who you think can align with the principles of NATS and would be interested in service 
2. Friends who would like to have a good time around Memorial Day weekend (food + entertainment + network + many educational/informative/ business seminars)
3. Know of any potential sponsors (corporate or individual) but need help from one of the NATS core members 
4. Businesses that can get benefited by putting up a stall or a booth or would like to participate in information sessions 
5. Businesses that would need brand awareness through our marketing channels 
6. People who just want to get their ads into a souvenir 
7. Finally, we know all of you are putting in time but if you are kind of to donate that would be greatly appreciated as well

Based on the information provided, the North America Telugu Society (NATS) is seeking support from members to help raise funds for their bi-annual conference. Members can assist in several ways, including:

1. Reaching out to friends who align with the principles of NATS and may be interested in service.
2. Connecting with friends who are looking for a fun Memorial Day weekend experience.
3. Identifying potential sponsors (corporate or individual) and working with NATS core members to approach them.
4. Engaging with businesses that could benefit from participating in information sessions, setting up a booth, or advertising through NATS marketing channels.
5. Donating time, resources, or funds to support the conference.

This is a comprehensive list of ways members can support the conference and the NATS organization.

North America Telugu Society was formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers of similar values to serve Telugu communities across North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities. Today, NATS is one of the largest non-profit national organizations for Telugu people living in North America
So far volunteers solicited, collected, and disbursed funds for charitable purposes to meet the goals of the organization; and to preserve, propagate and perpetuate Telugu cultural heritage in North America. Our flagship has been a 24x7 helpline 1-888-483-5848 to provide immediate assistance for anyone needing help
Bi-annually NATS conducts a 3-day convention where approximately 8000 people attend to celebrate Telugu culture. This year we are planning to celebrate our 7th annual convention at Raritan Convention Center from May 26-28. This three-day mega event includes various cultural, literary, and business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing Education classes, Women's forums, and career development for the younger generation.
Every year we invite a few dignitaries (e.g. Vice President of India Mr. Venkaiah Naidu, Apple Ex-CEO John Scully, Kapil Dev, Dean of Wharton Business School, etc.) state governors for the main event. We are planning to do the same.

The North America Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers. The organization serves Telugu communities in North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities, and provides a 24/7 helpline (1-888-483-5848) for emergency assistance. NATS also holds bi-annual conventions to celebrate Telugu culture, attracting approximately 8000 people. This year, the 7th annual convention is planned for May 26-28 at the Raritan Convention Center and will feature cultural, literary, and business events, along with forums for women and career development for young people. NATS invites dignitaries and state governors to participate in the main event.
thank you note for pledge

Dear [Name],

We wanted to express our heartfelt gratitude for your generous pledge to support the North America Telugu Society (NATS). Your contribution will help us to reach our goals and provide a platform for Telugu communities in North America to come together and celebrate our cultural heritage.

Your support is invaluable, and we are proud to have you as a member of our community. We are looking forward to working together to make this year's convention a success and continue to serve the needs of Telugu people in North America.

Once again, thank you for your generosity. We appreciate your commitment to NATS and look forward to seeing you at this year's convention.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
North America Telugu Society
more heartfelt thank you note for pledge

Dear [Name],

We are writing to express our deepest gratitude for your support to the North America Telugu Society (NATS). Your generosity has left us truly touched and inspired, and we cannot thank you enough for your pledge to our cause.

Your contribution will help us to achieve our goals and make a real difference in the lives of Telugu communities in North America. Your support will enable us to continue to provide a platform for our people to come together and celebrate our cultural heritage through educational, social, spiritual and cultural activities.

We are proud to have you as a part of our NATS family and appreciate your unwavering support. Your kindness and generosity will help us to continue our mission to serve the needs of the Telugu people in North America.

Once again, thank you from the bottom of our hearts. We are looking forward to seeing you at this year's convention and working together to make a positive impact.

With gratitude,
[Your Name]
North America Telugu Society
note to converting pledge to donation

Dear [Name],

We hope this email finds you well. We wanted to follow up on your pledge to support the North America Telugu Society (NATS) and remind you of the impact your donation can have on our community.

We are thrilled to announce that the preparations for our 7th annual convention are well underway, and your support is crucial in helping us to reach our goals. Your contribution will help us provide a platform for the Telugu community to come together and celebrate our cultural heritage through various educational, social, spiritual, and cultural activities.

We would like to kindly request that you convert your pledge into a donation so that we can continue to serve the needs of the Telugu community in North America. Your generosity will go a long way in helping us achieve our mission and make a real difference in the lives of our people.

If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. We are always here to assist you in any way we can.

Thank you again for your support, and we look forward to seeing you at this year's convention.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
North America Telugu Society
